title: PRONAF:Programa Nacional de Fortalecimento da Agricultura Familiar fazendo mais do mesmo no Brasil?
abstract: El propósito de este artículo es discutir, como el PRONAF (Programa Nacional de Fortalecimiento de la Agricultura familiar) mientras que es una política púbica de "Fortalecimiento de la Agricultura Familiar" ha contribuido para el aumento de la producción de mercancías (commodities para exportación) en zonas predominantes de agricultores familiares. Para tanto, fue realizado una investigación en áreas de agricultura familiar no norte do Rio Grande do Sul nos anos de 2017-18. Donde, analizaran algunas consideraciones sobre la estructura agraria, así como los datos de aumento de la productividad y el área utilizada en la producción de los principales cultivos de exportación en los años 2000-2018. E también algunas consideraciones de los entornos rurales cómo este modelo de agricultura ha degradado los ambientes, especialmente con el aumento de las tasas de aplicación de pesticidas a cada año en Río Grande del Sur y Brasil. Como resultados se observó que este modelo basado en la financiación pública significativa ha mantenido la pobreza rural, el endeudamiento y la dependencia de algunas regiones con fuerte producción primaria a expensas de otras regiones más industrializadas. Por último, presentamos una discusión sobre la necesidad de revisar el papel de las políticas públicas que promuevan la seguridad alimentaria, la recuperación y protección del medio ambiente mediante la promoción de la agroecología en zonas con presencia de los agricultores pobres de Brasil.

motivations: The PRONAF program, aimed at strengthening family agriculture in Brazil, may be contributing to increased commodity production for export, potentially harming the environment and rural communities.
Rural poverty, indebtedness, and dependence on primary production persist in certain regions despite significant public funding.
objectives: Analyze the impact of PRONAF on agricultural production, particularly commodity exports, in areas dominated by family farmers.
Assess the effects of this agricultural model on the environment, including pesticide use, and rural communities.
Discuss the need for revising public policies to promote food security, environmental protection, and agroecology in areas with poor farmers.
methods: Conducted research in areas of family agriculture in northern Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil, between 2017-2018.
Analyzed data on agricultural structure, productivity, and export crop production from 2000-2018.
Examined the environmental impact of this agricultural model, including pesticide application rates.
results: The PRONAF program has maintained rural poverty, indebtedness, and dependence on primary production in certain regions.
The agricultural model promoted by PRONAF has degraded the environment, particularly through increased pesticide use.
Revising public policies to promote agroecology and environmental protection is necessary to support poor farmers and rural communities.

motivations: The PRONAF program, while aimed at strengthening family farming, has contributed to the increase in commodity production in areas dominated by family farmers, raising questions about its effectiveness.
There is a concern about the degradation of rural environments due to this model of agriculture, especially with the increase in pesticide application rates in Rio Grande do Sul and Brazil.
The current model based on significant public funding has maintained rural poverty, indebtedness, and dependence of some regions on primary production at the expense of more industrialized regions.
objectives: Discuss the impact of the PRONAF program on the increase in commodity production in areas dominated by family farmers.
Analyze the agrarian structure, productivity increase data, and the area used in the production of major export crops between 2000-2018.
Discuss the need to review public policies that promote food security, environmental recovery and protection by promoting agroecology in areas with the presence of poor farmers in Brazil.
methods: Conduct a study in family farming areas in the north of Rio Grande do Sul in the years 2017-18.
Analyze considerations about the agrarian structure, as well as data on the increase in productivity and the area used in the production of major export crops in the years 2000-2018.
Discuss the impact of this agricultural model on rural environments, particularly the increase in pesticide application rates.
results: The PRONAF program has contributed to the increase in commodity production in areas dominated by family farmers.
This agricultural model has led to environmental degradation, particularly due to increased pesticide application rates.
The current model has perpetuated rural poverty, indebtedness, and regional dependence on primary production.

motivations: PRONAF, despite being designed to strengthen family farming, has contributed to increased commodity production for export in areas dominated by family farmers.
The current agricultural model has led to environmental degradation, rural poverty, and increased dependence on pesticides in family farming regions.
objectives: Analyze how PRONAF has influenced the shift toward export-oriented commodity production in family farming areas.
Examine the environmental and socioeconomic impacts of the current agricultural model on family farming regions in Rio Grande do Sul.
methods: Conduct field research in family farming areas in northern Rio Grande do Sul.
Analyze data on agricultural structure, productivity increases, and land use for export crops.
Examine pesticide application rates and environmental degradation indicators in Rio Grande do Sul and Brazil.
results: The public financing model has maintained rural poverty, indebtedness, and regional dependence on primary production.
There is a need to revise public policies to promote food security, environmental protection, and agroecology in areas with poor farmers.
